meanings.sent1: The dooms of the old building were evident in the crumbling walls.
meanings.sent2: The village faced the dooms of a severe drought.
meanings.sent3: The dooms of the broken vase were sealed when the cat knocked it off the table.
meanings.sent4: The dooms of the failing company were like a dark cloud hanging over the employees.
meanings.sent5: The dooms of the storm were approaching fast, threatening to destroy everything in its path.

meanings.definition: to condemn to certain destruction or death
meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer dooms the kingdom with his dark magic.
meanings.sent2: The judge's harsh sentence dooms the criminal to a life behind bars.
meanings.sent3: The careless mistake dooms the fragile vase to a shattered fate.
meanings.sent4: The reckless decision dooms the adventurer to a perilous journey.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's failed experiment dooms the lab rats to an unfortunate end.

meanings.definition: the Last Judgment, at the end of the world
meanings.sent1: In some religions, believers await the final dooms with both fear and hope.
meanings.sent2: The dooms described in the ancient prophecy foretell the end of all things.
meanings.sent3: The dooms party was a lighthearted gathering to celebrate the end of the world in style.
meanings.sent4: The dooms of the apocalypse loomed large in the minds of the doomsday preppers.
meanings.sent5: The preacher warned of the coming dooms, urging his congregation to repent before it was too late.
